question: [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/mod.rs] [Integration: executor_client] [Timeout Attack] If executor_client.execute_block() hangs indefinitely, does execute_block() have timeout protection, or will it block validator consensus indefinitely causing liveness failure? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/mod.rs] [Lines: 99] [Round Count Mismatch] If sharded_output[0] is the only shard with results and others are empty, will num_rounds be calculated incorrectly, causing aggregation to miss results from other shards? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/mod.rs] [Lines: 101] [Vector Size Attack] With 'vec![vec![]; num_executor_shards * num_rounds]', can integer overflow in multiplication cause allocation of wrong-sized vector, leading to out-of-bounds access? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Transaction Order Manipulation] Can an attacker exploit the round-robin ordering (round * num_shards + shard_id) to create transaction ordering that differs from original block order, enabling front-running attacks? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Deterministic Execution] If shards execute in parallel and produce outputs in non-deterministic order, does the aggregation at lines 103-111 guarantee identical transaction output order across all validators? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Atomicity Violation] If one shard fails mid-execution after others complete successfully, does the error handling ensure all partial results are discarded, or can partial state changes persist? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [State Divergence] Can timing differences in shard execution cause validators to aggregate results in different orders, leading to state root mismatches and consensus failure? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Cross-Shard Consistency] Does the aggregation logic verify that cross-shard state dependencies are satisfied before finalizing results, or can inconsistent cross-shard reads cause invalid state transitions? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Arc Reference Counting] Is the Arc<S> state_view properly ref-counted across all shards, or can premature drop cause use-after-free in concurrent shard execution? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/mod.rs] [Function: execute_block()] [Clone Attack] Can malicious state_view.clone() operations in executor_client create inconsistent views across shards, breaking execution determinism? (High)
